byline.contributor: Nicholas Fandos contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Pres Obama demands senior defense officials investigate accusations about altered reports on military campaign against Islamic State; action is response to New York Times article finding that Defense Department supervisors revised narratives on military failures, exaggerating progress of campaign against ISIS.
lead_paragraph: The president was responding to a New York Times report on a Pentagon investigation into whether intelligence reports overstated military progress against the Islamic State.

headline.main: Obama Orders Inquiry Into Intelligence on ISIS
headline.print_headline: Obama Orders Inquiry Into Intelligence on ISIS

snippet: The president was responding to a New York Times report on a Pentagon investigation into whether intelligence reports overstated military progress against the Islamic State.
